$comment: Discord control-plane runtime visibility schema. Snapshots are written by the control-plane runtime into shared/state/discord/runtime.json and are purely informational for dashboards. Absence of this data must never be treated as an error.
title: Discord Control-Plane Runtime Snapshot
description: Optional, non-authoritative status metadata emitted by the Discord control-plane runtime when deployed. This schema is used for read-only dashboard visibility and inspection only.

runtime_role.description: Indicates that this runtime operates as a control-plane rather than a streaming data-plane.

running.description: Whether the Discord runtime supervisor is actively running.

connected.description: Whether the Discord client connection is currently established.

last_heartbeat_ts.description: Timestamp of the most recent heartbeat tick emitted by the Discord runtime (UTC, ISO 8601).

task_count.description: Number of active tasks tracked by the Discord runtime.

guild_count.description: Number of Discord guilds the bot is currently connected to, if available.

status.description: Current visible Discord status, if exposed by the runtime.

text.description: Custom status text currently applied to the bot.

emoji.description: Unicode emoji associated with the current status, if any.

heartbeat.description: Heartbeat lifecycle metadata emitted by the Discord supervisor.

started_at.description: Timestamp indicating when the Discord runtime was started (UTC, ISO 8601).

last_tick_at.description: Timestamp of the most recent heartbeat tick (UTC, ISO 8601).

connected.description: Whether the heartbeat loop is actively reporting a connected state.

metadata.description: Optional diagnostic metadata from the heartbeat loop.

enabled.description: Deprecated. Legacy flag describing whether the runtime is enabled.

connection_state.description: Deprecated compatibility field for connection state.

started_at.description: Deprecated compatibility field for runtime start time.

status_text.description: Custom status text currently applied to the bot.

status_emoji.description: Unicode emoji associated with the current status, if any.
